How_They_Work_Together: TRIZ resolves contradictions in business model (speed vs quality), BMC structures the resolution
Example_Use_Case: Startup needs fast launch AND high quality → TRIZ Principle #35 Parameter Change: MVP with quality core + fast iterations on edges

How_They_Work_Together: White Hat = facts for S/W, Black Hat = threats, Yellow Hat = opportunities, Green Hat = creative strategies
Example_Use_Case: Career change decision: SWOT baseline → Six Hats explores each quadrant deeply

How_They_Work_Together: GTD reduces cognitive load → mental space for creativity, SCAMPER during Clarify generates innovative next actions
Example_Use_Case: Inbox item 'improve team communication' → SCAMPER: Can I ELIMINATE status meetings? → Test async video updates

How_They_Work_Together: 4-6 pomodoros = ideal deliberate practice session length, provides focus structure for weakness-targeted reps
Example_Use_Case: Learn coding: 6 pomodoros daily on weakest area (async/await), video review feedback loop

How_They_Work_Together: HBM addresses 'Am I capable?' (self-efficacy), Atomic Habits provides 4 Laws to make behavior automatic
Example_Use_Case: Exercise habit: HBM builds confidence → Atomic Habits makes routine automatic via cue-response loop

How_They_Work_Together: SMART = destination, Progressive Overload = path to get there with measurable increments

How_They_Work_Together: Growth Mindset = foundation belief that enables effortful practice, removes fear of failure
Example_Use_Case: Musician struggles with complex piece → Growth Mindset reframes mistakes as learning → commits to 10,000 deliberate reps

How_They_Work_Together: Eisenhower prioritizes what matters, GTD provides execution system for chosen priorities

How_They_Work_Together: PDCA = improvement cycle, Agile = iterative execution framework, combine for rapid learning loops
Example_Use_Case: Product development: Sprint = Plan-Do, Retrospective = Check-Act, next sprint incorporates learnings

How_They_Work_Together: Five Whys drills depth on single path, Ishikawa maps breadth across categories, together = complete picture
Example_Use_Case: Quality issue: Ishikawa identifies 5 potential categories → Five Whys on top 2 suspects → root cause

How_They_Work_Together: Pareto identifies vital 20%, Time Blocking protects dedicated time for high-impact work

How_They_Work_Together: SMART for individual goals, OKR for team/company alignment, cascading objectives

How_They_Work_Together: GTD organizes what to do, Pomodoro structures how to do it with focus intervals
Example_Use_Case: Next Action: 'Draft proposal' → 3 pomodoros scheduled, inbox checked between sessions

How_They_Work_Together: SCAMPER = systematic ideation prompts, Design Thinking = human-centered process, combine for creative solutions
Example_Use_Case: Empathize phase reveals user frustration → Ideate with SCAMPER: Can we REVERSE the workflow?

How_They_Work_Together: HBM diagnoses why behavior not happening (capability, motivation, prompt), Atomic Habits provides 4 Laws to fix it
Example_Use_Case: Want to read more: HBM shows low motivation → Atomic Habits 2nd Law: Make it attractive via temptation bundling

How_They_Work_Together: JTBD uncovers real customer needs, BMC structures business around those jobs

How_They_Work_Together: Growth Mindset embraces failure as learning, PDCA systematizes learning into improvement cycles
Example_Use_Case: Failed marketing campaign → Growth Mindset: 'What can we learn?' → PDCA Check: analyze data, Act: iterate

How_They_Work_Together: Eisenhower removes urgent-not-important, Pareto finds 20% of important that = 80% results, ultimate focus
Example_Use_Case: Week has 50 tasks → Eisenhower: 20 important → Pareto: 4 tasks = 80% impact → ruthless prioritization

How_They_Work_Together: Progressive Overload requires measurable increments, SMART provides measurement framework
Example_Use_Case: Strength training: SMART 'Bench 225lbs by June' → Progressive Overload: +2.5lbs every 5 days

Example_Use_Case: Product improvement: SCAMPER Adapt → triggers TRIZ Principle #26 Copying for solution

Example_Use_Case: Capture 100 items in GTD → Clarify with Eisenhower lens → Only Q1/Q2 get scheduled

How_They_Work_Together: Atomic Habits builds routine via 4 Laws, Pomodoro provides cue (timer) and reward structure
Example_Use_Case: Building writing habit: Cue = morning coffee, Response = 2 pomodoros writing, Reward = guilt-free breakfast

How_They_Work_Together: Five Whys finds root cause in Check phase, PDCA Act phase addresses root cause
